meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of echinoderms.
meanings.sent1: The echinodermatous creature had a unique way of moving along the ocean floor.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the echinodermatous features of the starfish.
meanings.sent3: The echinodermatous sea urchin decided to throw a spiky party for its friends.
meanings.sent4: Her personality was as echinodermatous as the spiny sea cucumber.
meanings.sent5: The echinodermatous texture of the sand dollar felt rough to the touch.

meanings.definition: Covered with spines or prickles like those of an echinoderm.
meanings.sent1: The hedgehog's echinodermatous back provided excellent protection from predators.
meanings.sent2: The cactus had echinodermatous spikes that deterred animals from approaching.
meanings.sent3: The echinodermatous porcupine was the star of the forest fashion show.
meanings.sent4: Her words were sharp and echinodermatous, leaving a lasting impact on the audience.
meanings.sent5: The echinodermatous thorns on the rose bush made it challenging to prune.
